aboutUsText:
## Hey there üëã,

We are Till and Pan, two brothers and students who want to make the best flashcards app in the world.

For our studies we learn a lot with flashcards and think that Spaced Repetition is a powerful learning tool that is currently not fully leveraged. 

That's why we're working on TubeCards to make it **the best flashcard app in the world**, but achieving this goal isn‚Äôt possible without you.

So if TubeCards is helping you, please consider üôè sponsoring TubeCards, as we really want TubeCards to stay an app without ads, premium models, subscriptions and dark patterns. If you have feedback or any suggestions, please send them to us.

importYourAnkiDeckMobileText:
##  Import your Anki deck
1. Export your deck with the [Anki Desktop app](https://apps.ankiweb.net/).
2. Send the exported file to your mobile phone
3. Click the button below and select the exported file to get an overview of the decks you want to import.

![](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/public-videos.getspace.app/space_import_anki.mp4)

Warning: The learning progress of the APKG file is currently not imported.

2. Export the table as a CSV file.

aboutMeText:
## Hey there üëã,

I'm Till, a master student in computer engineering and I've been working on TubeCards for almost three years now.

In my opinion Spaced Repetition is a powerful learning tool that is currently not fully leveraged. I would love to work many years to make **TubeCards the best Spaced Repetition app**, but achieving this goal isn‚Äôt possible without you.

So if TubeCards is helping you, please consider üôè sponsoring TubeCards, as I really want TubeCards to stay an app without ads, premium models and dark patterns. If you have feedback and any suggestions, keep them coming.

exportCSVText:
Export your decks by following the steps below:

1. Click the "Export" button below.
2. Within a day you will receive an email with a link to your decks.
3. Click on the link and download your decks compressed as a zip file. 
4. Uncompress the zip file with a program of your choice, e.g. with 7-Zip.

If you have any questions or problems, feel free to send a message in the menu under "Feedback".

whatsNew72Text:
# Release 1.9.0

Welcome to the 1.9.0 release of Space. In this update these features have been added:
- **Export to CSV**

  Export your decks and cards in the menu to CSV.

- **Improved spaced repetition algorithm**

  From now on, if you mark a card as "not known", it will remain due until you mark it as "known".

- **Add text to your images**

  With the new image editor you can directly add text to your images.

- **Improved Portuguese translation**

  Finally there is a professional translation for Portuguese.

Space is free to use, but if you like it, we would be happy if you would support us via "Support Space" in the menu.

whatsNew68Text:
# Release 1.8.0

Welcome to the 1.8.0 release of TubeCards. In this update these features have been added:
- **Strength and stability**

  Strength and Stability allow you to see at a glance how well you know your flashcards, making the algorithm more motivating and transparent.
  - Strength shows the percentage of cards you can answer well.
  - Stability shows how long you are able to answer your cards well.

  Improving the algorithm is currently our biggest priority, as it is the most important feature to you according to the poll in the menu.

- **Separator lines in the editor**

  There is a new button in the editor to add dividers. With it you can for example separate text sections from each other.

- **Shortcuts on all pages**

  There are new shortcuts on all pages. If you hover over buttons you will see the shortcuts.

More good news, my brother is taking a semester off and is helping out at TubeCards. This means there will be more frequent updates.

If you have any questions, feel free to send us a message in the menu under "Feedback" or email us at space.flashcards.app@gmail.com.

TubeCards is free to use, but if you like it, we would be happy if you would support us via "Support TubeCards" in the menu.
removeFromDeckCautionText: Are you sure you want to remove ${fullName} from the deck ${deckName}?
editorRightsText: Anyone with the link has access to the deck and can review and edit cards.
aboutSpaceText: TubeCards is a Spaced Repetition System (SRS) flashcard app and our mission is to make learning as pleasant and effective as possible.
whatsNew88Text:
# Release 2.1.0

Welcome to the 2.1.0 release of Space. In this update these features have been added:
- **Rename Space to TubeCards**

  Space is renamed to TubeCards. The reasons and the methodology to find the new name can be found in our blog https://tubecards.app/blog.

- **TubeCards is now open-source**

  TubeCards is now open-source and you can find the code on GitHub. Read more at https://tubecards.app/blog/open-source.

TubeCards is free to use, but if you like it, we would be happy if you would support us via "Support Space" in the menu.
migrateInformation:
We noticed that you created cards that are not associated with your account. Would you like to migrate these cards to the account you are about to log into?

Your cards will be permanently discarded if you don't migrate them.
whatsNew79Text:
# Release 2.0.0

Welcome to the 2.0.0 release of Space. In this update these features have been added:
- **Marketplace**

  Learn decks for free from other users and share your decks with them.

- **Draw shapes**

  Draw lines, arrows, rectangles, and circles on your flashcards.

TubeCards is free to use, but if you like it, we would be happy if you would support us via "Support Space" in the menu.

whatsNew60Text:
# What's New

## Learn on Windows and macOS

You can download the app directly from the [Windows Store](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/space-spaced-repetition/9n2zrwbkjkt9) or the [Mac App Store](https://apps.apple.com/de/app/space-spaced-repetition/id1546202212), links to the stores are on [tubecards.app](tubecards.app).

The Linux version is coming in a few months.
importSharedAnkiDeckText:
## Import a shared Anki deck
1. Go to [Ankis shared decks](https://ankiweb.net/shared/decks/).
2. Navigate to the deck you want to import.
3. Click on the "Download" button.
4. Click the button below and select the downloaded file to get an overview of the decks you want to import.
openCSVFileError: An error occurred while opening the file. Please make sure that "/" does not appear in the file name. If the error occurs nevertheless, please write us a message in the menu under "Feedback".

feedbackSubtitle: If there is anything that bothers you about the app or you have an idea, please send us a message and we will try to answer you as soon as possible.
question: Question

marketplaceWelcomeText: Learn decks for free from other users and share your decks with them.
whyAmIWorkingOnAnotherFlashcardApp:
## Why am I working on another flashcard app

It all started when I started a physics bachelor after my computer engineering bachelor. Since I was learning French with Anki at that time, I thought maybe I could apply Anki to physics as well.

After a year of successfully learning physics with Anki, I wanted to share my flashcards with my friends and collaborate on them. Since this is only possible with Anki via plugins and these were outdated, I started to contribute to the development of a plugin.

Unfortunately, the plugin is only usable by computer-savvy people. Due to the architecture of Anki, it is also not possible to simplify the plugin. Afterwards, I tried all sorts of flashcards apps and there were always things that bothered me. 

While on vacation with two friends, we started working on a new flashcards app and that's how TubeCards was born. Since then my two friends have started to work full time and I'm working almost alone on the app. But I'm not giving up, as I think that a really good flashcard app can greatly accelerate learning.
learnAsManyNewCardsAsYouCan: Learn as many new cards as you can.
sentRecoverInstructionsText: We have sent the password recover instructions to your email.
errorSelectExtensionText: Please select a file with the extension "${extension}".
stabilityExplanationText:
The memory stability shows how long you are able to answer your cards well.

For example, the memory stability of your name is very stable because it takes a long time until you forget your name.
accountAdvantagesText: This protects your data from a device loss and allows you to use TubeCards on multiple devices.
activeDecksSubtitleText: Decide if you want to actively learn the deck
dueCardsExplanationText:
Due cards are cards you don't remember well, these are the cards you should review.

For example, a card you just created and learned will become due again in a few days because you won't remember it so well by then.
strengthExplanationText:
The memory strength shows the percentage of cards you can answer well.

For example, the strength of a card you just learned is at 100% because it is very likely that you remember that card.
learnCardsOne: Only learn one card at a time

resetPasswordInfoText: Enter the email associated with your account and we'll send an email with instructions to reset your password.

notificationSubtitle17: The more you learn, the more things you will know.
whatsNew78Text:
# Release 1.10.0

Welcome to the 1.10.0 release of TubeCards. In this update these features have been added:
- **Listen to your flashcards while you learn them**

  You can set the language for the front and back in the deck settings.

- **Improve performance on Windows**

  This improves the performance on Windows by 10-20%.

- **Fix bugs that occurred during drawing images**

- **Make flashcards easier to flip while learning**

TubeCards is free to use, but if you like it, we would be happy if you would support us via "Support TubeCards" in the menu.
importCSVInstructionText:
Import a CSV file by following the steps below:

1. Create a table with two columns in your favorite spreadsheet app (e.g. Excel or Google Sheets).

   The first column corresponds to the front side, the second column to the back side. One row corresponds to one card.

2. Export the table as a CSV file with UTF-8 encoding and a comma as delimiter.

Tip: If you type the CSV file by hand and want to use commas in your text, you must wrap your text in quotation marks, e.g. A,B,C to "A,B,C".

If you then want to use quotation marks, you must also treat them specially, e.g. A,B"C to "A,B""C".
